newsitem.title: USA: Clarify CFO Fritz tenders resignation.
newsitem.headline: Clarify CFO Fritz tenders resignation.

text.p: Clarify Inc on Tuesday said Ray Fritz will resign as chief financial officer, effective Aug. 31, due to a serious illness in his family.

"We are already engaged in a search for a new CFO," Dave Stamm, chief executive officer, said in a statement. "Ray has ... done a wonderful job for us. (We) hope to soon find a worthy successor who can provide the financial leadership to complement the growth opportunities we see for Clarify in the coming years."
Fritz has been with Clarify for three years, helping guide it from about $6 million in annual revenues to a current rate of about $80 million.
Clarify provides front office solutions to bring companies closer to their customers. Its products are offered globally.
